intro: Biebersteinia multifida var. straussii, commonly known as the Strauss's multifid fern, is a rare and delicate fern native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that give it a lacy appearance. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are typically green and have a soft, velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
